sen.j: 池尻家（いけがみけ）は、藤原北家庶家清閑寺家庶家の堂上家。
sen.e: The Ikegami family was Toshoke and a collateral branch of the Seikanji family line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan.
The Ikegami family was Toshoke and a collateral branch of the Seikanji family line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan.
The Ikegami family was Toshoke and a collateral branch of the Seikanji family line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan.
The court noble family rank was Meike.
Their court noble family rank was Meike.
Their court noble family rank was Meike.

sen.j: 内大臣・清閑寺共房の次男である大納言・池尻共孝が池尻を称したのにはじまる。
sen.e: The family started when Major Counselor, Tomotaka, the second son of Minister of the Interior, Tomofusa SEIKANJI, called himself 'Ikegami'.
The family started when Major Counselor, Tomotaka, the second son of the Minister of the Interior, Tomofusa SEIKANJI, called himself 'Ikegami'.
The family started when Major Counselor, Tomotaka, the second son of the Minister of the Interior, Tomofusa SEIKANJI, called himself 'Ikegami.'
The hereditary stipend During the Edo period was 50 koku.
Their hereditary stipend During the Edo period was fifty koku.
Their hereditary stipend During the Edo period was fifty koku.

sen.j: 明治時代に至り、華族に列し、子爵に叙された。
sen.e: Since the Meiji period, the family ranked as Kazoku (nobility) and was bestowed upon the title viscount.
Since the Meiji period, the family ranked as Kazoku (nobility) and was bestowed the title viscount.
Since the Meiji period, the family ranked as Kazoku (nobility) and was bestowed the title viscount.

sen.j: 家紋は、勧修寺流に倣い「竹に雀」。
sen.e: The family crest was 'Bamboo and Sparrow', following the Kajuji family.
The family crest was 'Bamboo and Sparrow,' following the Kajuji family.
The family crest was 'Bamboo and Sparrow,' following the Kajuji family.
The family temple was the Hoonji Temple in Narutaki.
The family temple was the Hoonji Temple in Narutaki.
The family temple was the Hoon-ji Temple in Narutaki.
The family residence was located in Inzan Town.
